Create a script to check if a number is perfect or not.
bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

is_perfect() {
    num="$1"
    sum=0
    for ((i=1; i<num; i++)); do
        if [ $((num % i)) -eq 0 ]; then
            sum=$((sum + i))
        fi
    done
    if [ "$sum" -eq "$num" ]; then
        echo "$num is a perfect number"
    else
        echo "$num is not a perfect number"
    fi
}
is_perfect 28

Create a script to check if a given year is a leap year or not using the Zeller's congruence.
bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

is_leap_year() {
    year="$1"
    if [ $((year % 400)) -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "$year is a leap year"
    elif [ $((year % 100)) -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "$year is not a leap year"
    elif [ $((year % 4)) -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "$year is a leap year"
    else
        echo "$year is not a leap year"
    fi
}
is_leap_year 2020

Create a script to check if a number is prime or not.
bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

num=11
is_prime=true
for ((i=2; i<=num/2; i++)); do
    if [ $((num % i)) -eq 0 ]; then
        is_prime=false
        break
    fi
done
if [ "$is_prime" = true ]; then
    echo "$num is a prime number"
else
    echo "$num is not a prime number"
fi

    fi
done

Create a script to monitor system CPU usage by user and send an alert if any user consumes excessive CPU resources.
bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold="50"

users="$(ps -eo user,%cpu | grep -vE 'USER|%CPU' | sort -nr -k2 | head -n 5)"

while read -r line; do
    user=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $1}')
    cpu=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $2}')

    if [ "$cpu" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "User $user is consuming high CPU: $cpu%" | mail -s "High CPU User Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$users"

nl_command: Create a script to monitor system log files and send an alert if any logs are rotated or truncated.
bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

log_files="/var/log/*.log"

for file in $log_files; do
    current_size=$(stat -c %s $file)
    previous_size=$(cat $file.size)

    if [ "$current_size" -lt "$previous_size" ]; then
        echo "Log file $file has been rotated or truncated." | mail -s "Log Rotation Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done

Create a script to generate a list of all prime numbers up to a given limit.
bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

limit=50
echo "Prime numbers up to $limit:" 
for ((num=2; num<=limit; num++)); do
    is_prime=true
    for ((i=2; i<=num/2; i++)); do
        if [ $((num % i)) -eq 0 ]; then
            is_prime=false
            break
        fi
    done
    if [ "$is_prime" = true ]; then
        echo "$num"
    fi
done

Create a script to find the sum of all perfect numbers up to a given limit.
bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

sum_perfect_numbers() {
    limit="$1"
    sum=0
    for ((i=2; i<=limit; i++)); do
        divisor_sum=0
        for ((j=1; j<i; j++)); do
            if [ $((i % j)) -eq 0 ]; then
                divisor_sum=$((divisor_sum + j))
            fi
        done
        if [ "$divisor_sum" -eq "$i" ]; then
            sum=$((sum + i))
        fi
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_perfect_numbers 1000

Create a script to find the smallest number among the given list of numbers.

#!/bin/bash

smallest_number() {
    numbers="$@"
    min="$1"
    for number in $numbers; do
        if [ "$number" -lt "$min" ]; then
            min="$number"
        fi
    done
    echo "The smallest number is: $min"
}

sum=0

Create a script to monitor system disk space and send an alert if any disk is running out of space.
bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold="90"

disks="$(df -h | awk '{print $1,$5}' | grep '%' | sed 's/%//')"

while read -r line; do
    disk=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $1}')
    usage=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $2}')

    if [ "$usage" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "Disk $disk is running out of space: $usage%" | mail -s "Disk Space Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$disks"

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold="1"

current_hour=$(date +'%H')

if [ "$current_hour" -ge "8" ] && [ "$current_hour" -le "18" ]; then
    non_default_cpus="$(ps -eo pid,comm,psr --sort psr | awk '$3 != 0' | tail -n 5)"

    if [ -n "$non_default_cpus" ]; then
        echo "Processes with non-default CPU affinity for root user during business hours: $non_default_cpus" | mail -s "Root Non-default CPU Affinity during Business Hours Alert" user@example.com
    fi
fi

fi

Create a script to monitor system hardware sensor values and send an alert if any values exceed a certain threshold.
bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold="80"

sensors=$(sensors | grep -E 'Core|temp[0-9]' | awk '{print $2,$3}' | tr -d '+°C' | sed 's/°F/ F/g')

while read -r line; do
    value=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $2}')
    if [ "$value" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "Hardware sensor value exceeds threshold: $line" | mail -s "Hardware Sensor Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$sensors"

Create a script to monitor system SSL certificate expiration dates and send an alert if any certificates are about to expire.
bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

certificates="/etc/ssl/certs/*.crt"

for cert in $certificates; do
    expiration_date=$(openssl x509 -enddate -noout -in $cert | cut -d '=' -f 2)
    if [ $(date -d "$expiration_date" +%s) -lt $(date -d "now + 30 days" +%s) ]; then
        echo "SSL certificate $cert is about to expire on $expiration_date" | mail -s "SSL Certificate Expiry Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done

Create a script to check if a given number is a perfect number or not.
bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

is_perfect_number() {
    num="$1"
    sum=0
    for ((i=1; i<num; i++)); do
        if [ $((num % i)) -eq 0 ]; then
            sum=$((sum + i))
        fi
    done
    if [ "$sum" -eq "$num" ]; then
        echo "$num is a perfect number"
    else
        echo "$num is not a perfect number"
    fi
}
is_perfect_number 28

Create a script to monitor system disk space usage and send alerts if any partition exceeds a specified threshold.
bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold="90"
partitions=$(df -h | grep -vE '^Filesystem|tmpfs|cdrom' | awk '{print $6}' | sed 's/%//')

for partition in $partitions; do
    usage=$(df -h | grep $partition | awk '{print $5}' | sed 's/%//')
    if [ "$usage" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "$partition is almost full: $usage%" | mail -s "Disk Space Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done

Create a script to monitor system mounted filesystems and send an alert if any filesystems are unmounted.
bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

mounted_filesystems=$(df -h | grep -vE '^Filesystem|tmpfs' | awk '{print $6}')

for filesystem in $mounted_filesystems; do
    if [ ! -d "$filesystem" ]; then
        echo "Filesystem $filesystem is not mounted." | mail -s "Filesystem Unmount Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done

Create a script to monitor system user account privilege changes and send an alert if any user privileges are modified.
bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

privilege_changes="$(grep -E 'usermod' /var/log/auth.log | tail -n 5)"

if [ -n "$privilege_changes" ]; then
    echo "User account privilege changes detected: $privilege_changes" | mail -s "User Privilege Change Alert" user@example.com
fi

Monitor system filesystem mount options every 10 seconds for 1 minute and display the results.
bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

for ((i=0; i<6; i++)); do
    mount | grep '^/' | awk '{print $1, $4}' >> filesystem_mount_options.log
    sleep 10
done
